intro: Szlachetkoella mystacioides, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often resembling a cluster of small bells. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
